posts.name: Adam Bochek
posts.cooked:
Not a programmer, please help!

Setup is the following: SDS - MK4i Krakens PathPlanner Phoenix pro generated swerve code

The problem is: When we run teleop only everything works well, but if we run auto first the fieldcentric angle is off by approximately 110 degrees,  this is consistent, we have tried various fixes but with no success.

Unfortunately our programming mentor is away until our first event.  Any help is appreciated.  GITHUB repo here:

Contribute to 2200Rambotics/2024 development by creating an account on GitHub.

posts.name: Brendan Burke
posts.cooked: First question.  When you place the robot on the field in autonomous is the front facing in the forward direction of the field?  (If not there is a parameter in the code that must be set).

posts.name: Adam Bochek
posts.cooked: Yes it is.  All of our autos have the same starting orientation.

posts.name: Brendan Burke
posts.cooked: We had this issue and our lead programming fixed it.  I will ask him to look at this after school today.

posts.name: John Fogarty
posts.cooked:
Your CommandSwerveDrivetrain class is missing the code from CTRE that is supposed to fix this problem. Look at the periodic function.

//github.com/CrossTheRoadElec/Phoenix6-Examples/tree/main/java/SwerveWithPathPlanner

posts.name: Adam Bochek
John Fogarty
posts.cooked:
Have you run a Pigeon calibration with it it mounted to the robot in it’s current position?

The only bug we ran into was re-seeding the field orientation was not working on Red. Everything else after auto worked fine.

Bochek:

Additionally this seems very inconstant Some times the robot seems to come out of auto with field relative working correctly, some times its out 180 degrees.

Does this correlate to red side and blue side of the field?  I have heard of this happening and people having to look at alliance to flip the orientation.  Mainly blue acting normal then red flipping 180.

posts.name: Andy Gasser
posts.cooked:
It looks like you’re only reading the alliance from DriverStation when the robot is disabled. This is not sufficient, you should be reading it in autonomousInit() and teleopInit() . You are guaranteed the Driver Station will be connected in those init functions.

There are some cases where the robot never actually enters the disabled state. There is more discussion in this thread , amoung others.

posts.name: Thad House
posts.cooked: Theres actually a better option this year. Theres a new function you can overload called driverStationConnected that will be triggered only once, the first time the DS connects. When that is called, alliance data is guaranteed correct. And that happens at the beginning of the loop, before any other methods are called in the loop.

This may not fix the issue at all, but our team has a button on the driver controls that resets the navX. Just rotate to correct forward orientation, then press the button and wait a second. It makes forward forward again. This only fixes things if the issue is that forward is in the wrong orientation relative to the driver though.

posts.name: Andy Gasser
posts.cooked:
Jadon8069:

our team has a button on the driver controls that resets the navX.

This might work for you, but I would be careful recommending it to other teams. If they are using odometry or pose estimation (including AprilTags) in teleop, resetting the gyro without adjusting the estimated pose will cause more problems than it solves.

posts.name: Andy Gasser
posts.cooked: @Thad_House That seems like a great option when connected to an FMS , but what about in the shop? Wouldn’t this require teams to set their Team Station in Driver Station before connecting to the robot. It would also require a robot code restart to change the alliance.

posts.name: Thad House
posts.cooked: I’d argue you should probably be doing those things anyway. Or you’re going to hit edge cases.
